required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Multiple s.c Doses HS-20004 in Healthy Chinese Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blind, Single-centre, Placebo-controlled, Dose Escalation, Multiple s.c. DoseStudy to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of HS-20004 in Healthy Chinese Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in China. The aim of this trial is to assess the safety and tolerability for Multiple s.c injection of HS-20004 in healthy Chinese subjects

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 and up to 3 days after last treatment (Day 10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma HS-20004 concentration curve after the last s.c injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time 0 to 72 hours after the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak plasma concentration (Cmax) after the last dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time 0 to 72 hours after the last treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal elimination half-life (tÂ½) for HS-20004 after the last dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time 0 to 72 hours after the last treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 24-hour profiles of plasma glucose and serum insulin from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 24 hours after the first and last treatment

arm_group.description: Once daily subcutaneous dose for 7 Days of HS-20004 0.02 mg or Matched Placebo.
Once daily subcutaneous dose for 7 Days of HS-20004 0.04 mg or Matched Placebo.
Once daily subcutaneous dose for 7 Days of HS-20004 0.06 mg or Matched Placebo.
Once daily subcutaneous dose for 7 Days of HS-20004 0.08 mg or Matched Placebo.
